title: Corrie's Chris Harper says Nathan will propose to Bethany
title_page: Corrie's Chris Harper says Nathan will propose to Bethany | Daily Mail Online
text:
The nation has been gripped by the latest horrific Coronation Street storyline, which sees Nathan Curtis grooming 16-year-old schoolgirl Bethany Platt.
And the actor who plays him, Chris Harper, appeared on This Morning on Wednesday, where he said the dark storyline is 'only just the beginning for Bethany'.
Having lost her virginity to Nathan - Chris revealed the storyline has received a positive reaction from many survivors of sexual abuse, as it's important that young girls are made aware of the dangers that anyone in this position could face.
Scroll down for video
'There are darker times to come': Corrie's Chris Harper hinted to This Morning on Wednesday that Bethany Platt will be raped again as he reveals storyline has received a positive reaction from survivors of sexual abuse
Aiming to do good: The actor said the storyline has received a positive reaction from many survivors of sexual abuse
He said: 'Nathan has done it before to other people [groomed them] and is doing with other people still. Bethany is falling in love with him.
'She is going to be entering a dark space and Nathan introducing Neil is just the beginning. Counsellors call it love bombing and it can happen to anyone.
'The perpetrator pretends to be your hero but Bethany to Nathan is a commodity.
Talking to hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield, he revealed Bethany will accept Nathan's proposal, as he hinted she will suffer another harrowing rape, after already been forced into sex by his friend Neil
He said: 'Nathan has done it before to other people [groomed them] and is doing with other people still. Bethany is falling in love with him'
He continued: 'She is going to be entering a dark space and Nathan introducing Neil is just the beginning. Counsellors call it love bombing and it can happen to anyone'
Chris also spoke of the reaction he had received from survivors of sexual abuse. He said: 'Brilliant - just amazing. The community that's out there of victims and survivors, however they describe themselves, is brilliant...'
'Nathan will be proposing to her and Bethany starts wearing a ring. He wins her trust and makes her fall in love with him then flips it and plays on her age.'
Phillip asked him if he thought Nathan's time on the street would be short-lived and he replied: 'I hope so.'
Chris also spoke of the reaction he had received from survivors of sexual abuse.
He said: 'Brilliant - just amazing. The community that's out there of victims and survivors, however they describe themselves, is brilliant...
Sad: Nathan hinted that there are many more troubling times to come for Bethany
'They're used to just being splashed across tabloid headlines or ignored or labelled.
'It's a fantastic role. I actually burst into tears when I found out I got the role. My wife, who's brilliantly supportive, is the one who suggested I run the London Marathon for the NSPCC. It's a great part, but I also got to be a part of a greater message.'
Lucy Fallon, who plays Bethany, has previously spoken of the importance in raising awareness around the disturbing issue of child abuse following criticism of the show’s decision to air its current grooming plot pre-watershed.
Appearing on Loose Women recently, the 21-year old applauded the long running soap’s decision to tackle the subject head on in a bid to educate their younger fan base.
She said: 'It's important it is before the watershed.
We're trying to target people who watch Corrie. There are a lot of fans who are young teenagers, it's important that they watch it.’
